flawed_nl_solution:
1 hour has 60 minutes, therefore 1/2 hour has 1/2*60 = <<1/2*60=30>>30 minutes
1 minute has 60 seconds, therefore 30 minutes has 30*60 = <<1800=1800>>1800 seconds
If Julia's internet speed is 20MBps and each song has a size of 5MB, then it would take 5/20=1/5 seconds to download one song
If it takes 1/5 seconds to download 1 song, then in 1800 seconds, Julia could download 1800/(1/5) = 1800 * 5 = 9000 songs
#### 9000

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 5/20, not 1/5. It appears there was an off-by-one error in the fraction.
